summary: The FEMA Cybersecurity Improvement Act (H.R. 4579) aims to enhance cybersecurity measures within the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA). It amends the Homeland Security Act of 2002 to include the mitigation of cybersecurity risks as a key responsibility. The bill mandates the FEMA Administrator, in consultation with the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency, to submit a report to relevant congressional committees within a year, detailing the agency's efforts to address these risks.
